name: Malted White Chocolate Popcorn with Robin's Eggs
description: A wonderfully sweet and salty snack mix for Easter.
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) bag egg-shaped malted milk balls (such as Whoppers® Robin Eggs)
2 (6 ounce) packages white chocolate baking squares

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking sheet with waxed paper.
Mix popcorn, corn flakes, and malted milk balls in a large bowl.

Place white chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave until white chocolate is completely melted, stirring after each 1-minute interval. Stir malted milk powder and shortening through the melted white chocolate until smooth.

Pour white chocolate mixture over popcorn mixture; toss to evenly coat. Spread popcorn mixture onto the prepared baking sheet. Refrigerate until set, about 30 minutes. Break apart and store in an airtight container.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Malted White Chocolate Popcorn with Robin's Eggs

review.reviewBody: 03-26-16 ~ Made this for our Easter snack. We liked it, but didn't love it. The batch in the green bowl has the malted milk powder on it, the blue bowl is without. We liked the batch without better, so we mixed the two batches up. I would make this again, but the next time I'm going to use popcorn puffs rather than real popcorn. It was fun and festive and we liked the crunch from the corn flakes.

Awesome! The kids LOVE it and hubby and I LOVE it! Great textures and flavors and this couldn't be easier. This would make a great teacher's gift. I will def be making this for Easter~YUM, YUM, YUM!!!!!!! Thanks for sharing. :)

The perfect salty and sweet mixture. I made it the first time as directed but substituted the corn flakes for thin pretzel sticks. This time I was going for Fall. I used about 2 cups of Brach's Mellowcreme Autumn Mix in place of the malt balls. I still used the pretzel sticks. I saw that Hershey's had a White Chocolate Candy Corn M&M. Sadly despite the store telling me exactly which aisle they were in they were out of stock. Instead of those I picked out all of the yellow orange and brown pieces of Shareable Packs of Dark Peanut and Caramel M&M's. That came to right about 2 cups. I decided that the candy seemed to be too high of a proportion to the popcorn and pretzels so I added so more popcorn. I then added about 6 oz. more white chocolate. I omitted the malted milk because I wasn't using the malt balls. I tasted a couple of pieces that fell on the counter. Who wouldn't; right? I thought it tasted great. Bro takes it into work tomorrow. I'm sure they are going to love this version as much as they did the Easter version.
